text: Data integrity is a term used in computer science and telecommunications that can mean: * Making sure that data is "whole" or complete. * The conditions by which data are maintained during any operation (such as transfer, storage or retrieval). * The correct storage of data for further use. * The rules for measuring data quality. Simply, data integrity is to make sure that data is "consistent" and "correct". Category:Computer science Category:Communication
title: Data integrity
